isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE AND FENDERS - IC BUS - REMOVE AND INSTALL - GRILLE

svcsubproc.title: Standard Grille -Remove
svcsubproc.para: The standard grille for the IC BUS is molded as a one-piece removable grille assembly, painted the same color ( Figure 15). The fender splash panels must removed to access grille for removal.
Refer to Figure 12 for the following Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Release hood latches each side and tilt hood forward.
The fender splash panels must be removed each side to access the grille area.
Remove the 4 push-in fasteners (Item 1) securing the radiator to shell seal (Item 2) to the hood. Remove the radiator to shell seal, passenger side shown.
Drill out the rivets (Item 3) attaching the splash panel to the hood/fender assembly (Item 5), passenger side shown.
Remove the splash panel, and repeat the procedure to remove driver side radiator to shell and hood/fender splash panel.
Remove four number 10 x 1.0" black screws ( Item 1, Figure 16) from tabs securing grille to hood assembly. An assistant is required to support grille when being removed from hood and fender assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Grille Remove and Install Details

svcsubproc.title: Grille - Install
svcsubproc.para: Reference Figure 12 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With assistant, place grille in grille opening and align the four mounting holes on the hood assembly with the mounting holes in grille.
Insert four number 10 x 1.0" long black screws and fasten.
Position the hood/fender splash panel (Item 4) on the inner fender of the hood/fender assembly (Item 5). Install rivets (Item 3) attaching it to the hood fender assembly, passenger side shown.
Position the radiator to the shell seal (Item 2) in place on the hood and install 4 push-in fasteners (Item 1) securing it to the hood, passenger side shown.
Repeat same procedure to secure driver side hood/fender splash panel and radiator to shell seal.
